kinetic.admin

Interface KineticAdminClient

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AdvancedKineticClient, GenericKineticClient, KineticClient, KineticP2pClient

    public interface KineticAdminClient
extends KineticP2pClient
    Kinetic administrative client interface.

    Kinetic administrators use this interface to setup kinetic drives. such as set up access control list for the drives.

    All administrative operations by default use SSL connections to connect to the Drive or Simulator. And this is the only supported transport for all administrative operations.

    Author:
    James Hughes., Chiaming Yang, Chenchong Li

    • Method Detail

      • firmwareDownload

        void firmwareDownload(byte[] pin,
                    byte[] bytes)
                      throws KineticException
        Load firmware byte[] to the drive.

        The firmware byte[] is itself protected on its own for integrity, authenticity, etc

        Parameters:
        pin - Compare the pin with drive's pin. If equal, can download firmware the information for the drive, if not, drive will reject the firmwareDownload request.
        bytes - update firmware bytes for the drive.
        Throws:
        KineticException - if unable to load firmware bytes to the drive.

      • getLog

        KineticLog getLog()
                  throws KineticException
        Get all Kinetic logs, such as the utilization temperature and capacity information from the drive.

        Returns:
        All the KineticLog Log information obtained from the Kinetic drive, including Utilization, Temperature, and Capacity, etc.
        Throws:
        KineticException - if any internal error occurred.
        See Also:
        KineticLog, Utilization, Temperature, Capacity

      • getLog

        KineticLog getLog(java.util.List<KineticLogType> listOfLogType)
                  throws KineticException
        Get a subset of specific Kinetic log information based on the log types specified in the parameter.

        The list of KineticLogType must not be empty, otherwise a KineticException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        listOfLogType - a subset of Kinetic log information to be returned.
        Returns:
        a subset of Kinetic log information based on the log types specified in the parameter.
        Throws:
        KineticException - if any internal errors occurred.

      • getVendorSpecificDeviceLog

        Device getVendorSpecificDeviceLog(byte[] name)
                                  throws KineticException
        Get the vendor specific log message.

        The Device GetLog message is to ask the device to send back the log of a certain name in the value field. The limit of each log is 1m byte.

        Proprietary names should be prefaced by the vendor name so that name collisions do not happen in the future. An example could be names that start with "com.wd" would be for Western Digital devices.

        If the name is not found, the EntryNotFoundException is thrown.

        There can be only one Device in the list of logs that can be retrieved.

        Parameters:
        name - the vendor specific name for the getLog command.
        Returns:
        Device that contains the name and value for the getLog command.
        Throws:
        EntryNotFoundException - if unable to get the log entry for the specified name.
        KineticException - if any internal errors occur.

        void setLockPin(byte[] oldLockPin,
              byte[] newLockPin)
                throws KineticException
        Set Security Lock pin.
        Parameters:
        oldLockPin - old lock pin used to authenticate.
        newLockPin - the new lock pin to set to the kinetic drive/simulator.
        Throws:
        KineticException - if any internal error occurred.

      • instantErase

        void instantErase(byte[] pin)
                  throws KineticException
        Erase all data in database for the drive.

        Erase data in database with Db API.

        Parameters:
        pin - Compare the pin with drive's pin. If equal, can download firmware the information for the drive, if not, drive will reject the firmwareDownload request.
        Throws:
        KineticException - if unable to load firmware bytes to the drive.

      • secureErase

        void secureErase(byte[] pin)
                 throws KineticException
        Securely erase all user data, configurations, and setup information on the drive.
        Parameters:
        pin - the pin used to authenticate for this operation.
        Throws:
        KineticException - if unable to perform the pin operation.
        See Also:
        setErasePin(byte[], byte[])

      • lockDevice

        void lockDevice(byte[] pin)
                throws KineticException
        Lock the device with the specified pin.

        If the Client has set a non-zero length locking pin (to enable locking), a subsequent call to lockDevice will lock the device.

        Parameters:
        pin - the pin to authenticate to the service.
        Throws:
        KineticException - if any internal error occurred.
        See Also:
        setLockPin(byte[], byte[])

      • unLockDevice

        void unLockDevice(byte[] pin)
                  throws KineticException
        Unlock the device with the specified pin.

        A successful unLockDevice call will unlock the previous locked device.

        Parameters:
        pin - the pin to authenticate to the service.
        Throws:
        KineticException - if any internal error occurred.
        See Also:
        lockDevice(byte[])
